summary: The document is a CIA memorandum dated 24 April 1968, detailing the creation and dissemination of an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray, in response to a request from Mr. Richard Ober of the DDP/CI. It includes physical descriptions of Ray, noting distinctive features, and a list of international locations. The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: The document details the creation of an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray, a key figure in the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr.
Physical descriptions of Ray are provided, including unique identifiers like his ear's appearance and scars.
The document includes a list of various international locations, though their relevance to the case is not explicitly stated.
It was prepared with the cooperation of Mr. Joseph Baglio and includes photographs and a list of stations.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
